00070 #define OSD_OI_FID_NR         (1UL << 7)
00071 #define OSD_OI_FID_NR_MAX     (1UL << OSD_OI_FID_OID_BITS_MAX)
00072 unsigned int osd_oi_count = OSD_OI_FID_NR;
00073

00075 /*
00076  * zfs osd maintains names for known fids in the name hierarchy
00077  * so that one can mount filesystem with regular ZFS stack and
00078  * access files
00079  */
00080 struct named_oid {
00081         unsigned long    oid;
00082         char            *name;
00083 };
00084 
00085 static const struct named_oid oids[] = {
00086         { LAST_RECV_OID,                LAST_RCVD },
00087         { OFD_LAST_GROUP_OID,           "LAST_GROUP" },
00088         { LLOG_CATALOGS_OID,            "CATALOGS" },
00089         { MGS_CONFIGS_OID,              NULL /*MOUNT_CONFIGS_DIR*/ },
00090         { FID_SEQ_SRV_OID,              "seq_srv" },
00091         { FID_SEQ_CTL_OID,              "seq_ctl" },
00092         { FLD_INDEX_OID,                "fld" },
00093         { MDD_LOV_OBJ_OID,              LOV_OBJID },
00094         { OFD_HEALTH_CHECK_OID,         HEALTH_CHECK },
00095         { ACCT_USER_OID,                "acct_usr_inode" },
00096         { ACCT_GROUP_OID,               "acct_grp_inode" },
00097         { REPLY_DATA_OID,               REPLY_DATA },
00098         { 0,                            NULL }
00099 };
00100 
00101 static char *oid2name(const unsigned long oid)
00102 {
00103         int i = 0;
00104 
00105         while (oids[i].oid) {
00106                 if (oids[i].oid == oid)
00107                         return oids[i].name;
00108                 i++;
00109         }
00110         return NULL;
00111 }
00112 
00116 static int
00117 osd_oi_lookup(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o,
00118               uint64_t parent, const char *name, struct osd_oi *oi)
00119 {
00120         struct zpl_direntry     *zde = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_zde.lzd_reg;
00121         int                      rc;
00122 
00123         rc = -zap_lookup(o->od_os, parent, name, 8, 1, (void *)zde);
00124         if (rc)
00125                 return rc;
00126 
00127         rc = strlcpy(oi->oi_name, name, sizeof(oi->oi_name));
00128         if (rc >= sizeof(oi->oi_name))
00129                 return -E2BIG;
00130 
00131         oi->oi_zapid = zde->zde_dnode;
00132 
00133         return 0;
00134 }
00135 
00139 static int
00140 osd_oi_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o,
00141               uint64_t parent, const char *name, uint64_t *child)
00142 {
00143         struct zpl_direntry     *zde = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_zde.lzd_reg;
00144         struct lu_attr          *la = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_la;
00145         dmu_buf_t               *db;
00146         dmu_tx_t                *tx;
00147         int                      rc;
00148 
00149         /* verify it doesn't already exist */
00150         rc = -zap_lookup(o->od_os, parent, name, 8, 1, (void *)zde);
00151         if (rc == 0)
00152                 return -EEXIST;
00153 
00154         /* create fid-to-dnode index */
00155         tx = dmu_tx_create(o->od_os);
00156         if (tx == NULL)
00157                 return -ENOMEM;
00158 
00159         dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, DMU_NEW_OBJECT, 1, NULL);
00160         dmu_tx_hold_bonus(tx, parent);
00161         dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, parent, TRUE, name);
00162         LASSERT(tx->tx_objset->os_sa);
00163         dmu_tx_hold_sa_create(tx, ZFS_SA_BASE_ATTR_SIZE);
00164 
00165         rc = -dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
00166         if (rc) {
00167                 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
00168                 return rc;
00169         }
00170 
00171         la->la_valid = LA_MODE | LA_UID | LA_GID;
00172         la->la_mode = S_IFDIR | S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR | S_IXUGO;
00173         la->la_uid = la->la_gid = 0;
00174         __osd_zap_create(env, o, &db, tx, la, parent, 0);
00175 
00176         zde->zde_dnode = db->db_object;
00177         zde->zde_pad = 0;
00178         zde->zde_type = IFTODT(S_IFDIR);
00179 
00180         rc = -zap_add(o->od_os, parent, name, 8, 1, (void *)zde, tx);
00181 
00182         dmu_tx_commit(tx);
00183 
00184         *child = db->db_object;
00185         sa_buf_rele(db, osd_obj_tag);
00186 
00187         return rc;
00188 }
00189 
00190 static int
00191 osd_oi_find_or_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o,
00192                       uint64_t parent, const char *name, uint64_t *child)
00193 {
00194         struct osd_oi   oi;
00195         int             rc;
00196 
00197         rc = osd_oi_lookup(env, o, parent, name, &oi);
00198         if (rc == 0)
00199                 *child = oi.oi_zapid;
00200         else if (rc == -ENOENT)
00201                 rc = osd_oi_create(env, o, parent, name, child);
00202 
00203         return rc;
00204 }
00205 
00210 int osd_fld_lookup(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00211                    u64 seq, struct lu_seq_range *range)
00212 {
00213         struct seq_server_site  *ss = osd_seq_site(osd);
00214 
00215         if (fid_seq_is_idif(seq)) {
00216                 fld_range_set_ost(range);
00217                 range->lsr_index = idif_ost_idx(seq);
00218                 return 0;
00219         }
00220 
00221         if (!fid_seq_in_fldb(seq)) {
00222                 fld_range_set_mdt(range);
00223                 if (ss != NULL)
00224                         /* FIXME: If ss is NULL, it suppose not get lsr_index
00225                          * at all */
00226                         range->lsr_index = ss->ss_node_id;
00227                 return 0;
00228         }
00229 
00230         LASSERT(ss != NULL);
00231         fld_range_set_any(range);
00232         /* OSD will only do local fld lookup */
00233         return fld_local_lookup(env, ss->ss_server_fld, seq, range);
00234 }
00235 
00236 int fid_is_on_ost(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00237                   const struct lu_fid *fid)
00238 {
00239         struct lu_seq_range     *range = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_seq_range;
00240         int                     rc;
00241         ENTRY;
00242 
00243         if (fid_is_idif(fid))
00244                 RETURN(1);
00245 
00246         if (unlikely(fid_is_local_file(fid) || fid_is_llog(fid)) ||
00247                      fid_is_name_llog(fid) || fid_is_quota(fid))
00248                 RETURN(0);
00249 
00250         rc = osd_fld_lookup(env, osd, fid_seq(fid), range);
00251         if (rc != 0) {
00252                 if (rc != -ENOENT)
00253                         CERROR("%s: "DFID" lookup failed: rc = %d\n",
00254                                osd_name(osd), PFID(fid), rc);
00255                 RETURN(0);
00256         }
00257 
00258         if (fld_range_is_ost(range))
00259                 RETURN(1);
00260 
00261         RETURN(0);
00262 }
00263 
00264 static struct osd_seq *osd_seq_find_locked(struct osd_seq_list *seq_list,
00265                                            u64 seq)
00266 {
00267         struct osd_seq *osd_seq;
00268 
00269         list_for_each_entry(osd_seq, &seq_list->osl_seq_list, os_seq_list) {
00270                 if (osd_seq->os_seq == seq)
00271                         return osd_seq;
00272         }
00273         return NULL;
00274 }
00275 
00276 static struct osd_seq *osd_seq_find(struct osd_seq_list *seq_list, u64 seq)
00277 {
00278         struct osd_seq *osd_seq;
00279 
00280         read_lock(&seq_list->osl_seq_list_lock);
00281         osd_seq = osd_seq_find_locked(seq_list, seq);
00282         read_unlock(&seq_list->osl_seq_list_lock);
00283 
00284         return osd_seq;
00285 }
00286 
00287 static struct osd_seq *osd_find_or_add_seq(const struct lu_env *env,
00288                                            struct osd_device *osd, u64 seq)
00289 {
00290         struct osd_seq_list     *seq_list = &osd->od_seq_list;
00291         struct osd_seq          *osd_seq;
00292         char                    *key = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_buf;
00293         char                    *seq_name = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_str;
00294         struct osd_oi           oi;
00295         uint64_t                sdb, odb;
00296         int                     i;
00297         int                     rc = 0;
00298         ENTRY;
00299 
00300         osd_seq = osd_seq_find(seq_list, seq);
00301         if (osd_seq != NULL)
00302                 RETURN(osd_seq);
00303 
00304         down(&seq_list->osl_seq_init_sem);
00305         /* Check again, in case some one else already add it
00306          * to the list */
00307         osd_seq = osd_seq_find(seq_list, seq);
00308         if (osd_seq != NULL)
00309                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00310 
00311         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(osd_seq);
00312         if (osd_seq == NULL)
00313                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00314 
00315         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&osd_seq->os_seq_list);
00316         osd_seq->os_seq = seq;
00317 
00318         /* Init subdir count to be 32, but each seq can have
00319          * different subdir count */
00320         osd_seq->os_subdir_count = OSD_OST_MAP_SIZE;
00321         OBD_ALLOC(osd_seq->os_compat_dirs,
00322                   sizeof(uint64_t) * osd_seq->os_subdir_count);
00323         if (osd_seq->os_compat_dirs == NULL)
00324                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00325 
00326         oi.oi_zapid = osd->od_O_id;
00327         sprintf(seq_name, (fid_seq_is_rsvd(seq) ||
00328                 fid_seq_is_mdt0(seq)) ?  LPU64 : LPX64i,
00329                 fid_seq_is_idif(seq) ? 0 : seq);
00330 
00331         rc = osd_oi_find_or_create(env, osd, oi.oi_zapid, seq_name, &odb);
00332         if (rc != 0) {
00333                 CERROR("%s: Can not create %s : rc = %d\n",
00334                        osd_name(osd), seq_name, rc);
00335                 GOTO(out, rc);
00336         }
00337 
00338         for (i = 0; i < OSD_OST_MAP_SIZE; i++) {
00339                 sprintf(key, "d%d", i);
00340                 rc = osd_oi_find_or_create(env, osd, odb, key, &sdb);
00341                 if (rc)
00342                         GOTO(out, rc);
00343                 osd_seq->os_compat_dirs[i] = sdb;
00344         }
00345 
00346         write_lock(&seq_list->osl_seq_list_lock);
00347         list_add(&osd_seq->os_seq_list, &seq_list->osl_seq_list);
00348         write_unlock(&seq_list->osl_seq_list_lock);
00349 out:
00350         up(&seq_list->osl_seq_init_sem);
00351         if (rc != 0) {
00352                 if (osd_seq != NULL && osd_seq->os_compat_dirs != NULL)
00353                         OBD_FREE(osd_seq->os_compat_dirs,
00354                                  sizeof(uint64_t) * osd_seq->os_subdir_count);
00355                 if (osd_seq != NULL)
00356                         OBD_FREE_PTR(osd_seq);
00357                 osd_seq = ERR_PTR(rc);
00358         }
00359         RETURN(osd_seq);
00360 }
00361 
00362 /*
00363  * objects w/o a natural reference (unlike a file on a MDS)
00364  * are put under a special hierarchy /O/<seq>/d0..dXX
00365  * this function returns a directory specific fid belongs to
00366  */
00367 static uint64_t
00368 osd_get_idx_for_ost_obj(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00369                         const struct lu_fid *fid, char *buf)
00370 {
00371         struct osd_seq  *osd_seq;
00372         unsigned long   b;
00373         u64             id;
00374         int             rc;
00375 
00376         osd_seq = osd_find_or_add_seq(env, osd, fid_seq(fid));
00377         if (IS_ERR(osd_seq)) {
00378                 CERROR("%s: Can not find seq group "DFID"\n", osd_name(osd),
00379                        PFID(fid));
00380                 return PTR_ERR(osd_seq);
00381         }
00382 
00383         if (fid_is_last_id(fid)) {
00384                 id = 0;
00385         } else {
00386                 rc = fid_to_ostid(fid, &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_ostid);
00387                 LASSERT(rc == 0); /* we should not get here with IGIF */
00388                 id = ostid_id(&osd_oti_get(env)->oti_ostid);
00389         }
00390 
00391         b = id % OSD_OST_MAP_SIZE;
00392         LASSERT(osd_seq->os_compat_dirs[b]);
00393 
00394         sprintf(buf, LPU64, id);
00395 
00396         return osd_seq->os_compat_dirs[b];
00397 }
00398 
00399 /* XXX: f_ver is not counted, but may differ too */
00400 static void osd_fid2str(char *buf, const struct lu_fid *fid)
00401 {
00402         sprintf(buf, DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(fid));
00403 }
00404 
00405 /*
00406  * Determine the zap object id which is being used as the OI for the
00407  * given fid.  The lowest N bits in the sequence ID are used as the
00408  * index key.  On failure 0 is returned which zfs treats internally
00409  * as an invalid object id.
00410  */
00411 static uint64_t
00412 osd_get_idx_for_fid(struct osd_device *osd, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00413                     char *buf)
00414 {
00415         struct osd_oi *oi;
00416 
00417         LASSERT(osd->od_oi_table != NULL);
00418         oi = osd->od_oi_table[fid_seq(fid) & (osd->od_oi_count - 1)];
00419         osd_fid2str(buf, fid);
00420 
00421         return oi->oi_zapid;
00422 }
00423 
00424 uint64_t osd_get_name_n_idx(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00425                             const struct lu_fid *fid, char *buf)
00426 {
00427         uint64_t zapid;
00428 
00429         LASSERT(fid);
00430         LASSERT(buf);
00431 
00432         if (fid_is_on_ost(env, osd, fid) == 1 || fid_seq(fid) == FID_SEQ_ECHO) {
00433                 zapid = osd_get_idx_for_ost_obj(env, osd, fid, buf);
00434         } else if (unlikely(fid_seq(fid) == FID_SEQ_LOCAL_FILE)) {
00435                 /* special objects with fixed known fids get their name */
00436                 char *name = oid2name(fid_oid(fid));
00437 
00438                 if (name) {
00439                         zapid = osd->od_root;
00440                         strcpy(buf, name);
00441                         if (fid_is_acct(fid))
00442                                 zapid = MASTER_NODE_OBJ;
00443                 } else {
00444                         zapid = osd_get_idx_for_fid(osd, fid, buf);
00445                 }
00446         } else {
00447                 zapid = osd_get_idx_for_fid(osd, fid, buf);
00448         }
00449 
00450         return zapid;
00451 }
00452 
00453 static inline int fid_is_fs_root(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00454 {
00455         /* Map root inode to special local object FID */
00456         return fid_seq(fid) == FID_SEQ_LOCAL_FILE &&
00457                 fid_oid(fid) == OSD_FS_ROOT_OID;
00458 }
00459 
00460 int osd_fid_lookup(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *dev,
00461                    const struct lu_fid *fid, uint64_t *oid)
00462 {
00463         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00464         char                    *buf = info->oti_buf;
00465         uint64_t                zapid;
00466         int                     rc = 0;
00467         ENTRY;
00468 
00469         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_SRV_ENOENT))
00470                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00471 
00472         if (unlikely(fid_is_acct(fid))) {
00473                 if (fid_oid(fid) == ACCT_USER_OID)
00474                         *oid = dev->od_iusr_oid;
00475                 else
00476                         *oid = dev->od_igrp_oid;
00477         } else if (unlikely(fid_is_fs_root(fid))) {
00478                 *oid = dev->od_root;
00479         } else {
00480                 zapid = osd_get_name_n_idx(env, dev, fid, buf);
00481 
00482                 rc = -zap_lookup(dev->od_os, zapid, buf,
00483                                 8, 1, &info->oti_zde);
00484                 if (rc)
00485                         RETURN(rc);
00486                 *oid = info->oti_zde.lzd_reg.zde_dnode;
00487         }
00488 
00489         if (rc == 0)
00490                 dmu_prefetch(dev->od_os, *oid, 0, 0);
00491 
00492         RETURN(rc);
00493 }
00494 
00498 static void
00499 osd_oi_remove_table(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o, int key)
00500 {
00501         struct osd_oi *oi;
00502 
00503         LASSERT(key < o->od_oi_count);
00504 
00505         oi = o->od_oi_table[key];
00506         if (oi) {
00507                 if (oi->oi_db)
00508                         sa_buf_rele(oi->oi_db, osd_obj_tag);
00509                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oi);
00510                 o->od_oi_table[key] = NULL;
00511         }
00512 }
00513 
00517 static int
00518 osd_oi_add_table(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o,
00519                  char *name, int key)
00520 {
00521         struct osd_oi *oi;
00522         int rc;
00523 
00524         LASSERT(key < o->od_oi_count);
00525         LASSERT(o->od_oi_table[key] == NULL);
00526 
00527         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(oi);
00528         if (oi == NULL)
00529                 return -ENOMEM;
00530 
00531         rc = osd_oi_lookup(env, o, o->od_root, name, oi);
00532         if (rc) {
00533                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oi);
00534                 return rc;
00535         }
00536 
00537         o->od_oi_table[key] = oi;
00538         __osd_obj2dbuf(env, o->od_os, oi->oi_zapid, &oi->oi_db);
00539 
00540         return 0;
00541 }
00542 
00546 static void
00547 osd_oi_close_table(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o)
00548 {
00549         int i;
00550 
00551         for (i = 0; i < o->od_oi_count; i++)
00552                 osd_oi_remove_table(env, o, i);
00553 }
00554 
00558 static int
00559 osd_oi_open_table(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o, int count)
00560 {
00561         char name[16];
00562         int  i, rc = 0;
00563         ENTRY;
00564 
00565         for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00566                 sprintf(name, "%s.%d", DMU_OSD_OI_NAME_BASE, i);
00567                 rc = osd_oi_add_table(env, o, name, i);
00568                 if (rc) {
00569                         osd_oi_close_table(env, o);
00570                         break;
00571                 }
00572         }
00573 
00574         RETURN(rc);
00575 }
00576 
00580 static int
00581 osd_oi_probe(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o, int *count)
00582 {
00583         uint64_t        root_oid = o->od_root;
00584         struct osd_oi   oi;
00585         char            name[16];
00586         int             rc;
00587         ENTRY;
00588 
00589         /*
00590          * Check for multiple OIs and determine the count.  There is no
00591          * gap handling, if an OI is missing the wrong size can be returned.
00592          * The only safeguard is that we know the number of OIs must be a
00593          * power of two and this is checked for basic sanity.
00594          */
00595         for (*count = 0; *count < OSD_OI_FID_NR_MAX; (*count)++) {
00596                 sprintf(name, "%s.%d", DMU_OSD_OI_NAME_BASE, *count);
00597                 rc = osd_oi_lookup(env, o, root_oid, name, &oi);
00598                 if (rc == 0)
00599                         continue;
00600 
00601                 if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00602                         if (*count == 0)
00603                                 break;
00604 
00605                         if ((*count & (*count - 1)) != 0)
00606                                 RETURN(-EDOM);
00607 
00608                         RETURN(0);
00609                 }
00610 
00611                 RETURN(rc);
00612         }
00613 
00614         /*
00615          * No OIs exist, this must be a new filesystem.
00616          */
00617         *count = 0;
00618 
00619         RETURN(0);
00620 }
00621 
00622 static void osd_ost_seq_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd)
00623 {
00624         struct osd_seq_list *osl = &osd->od_seq_list;
00625 
00626         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&osl->osl_seq_list);
00627         rwlock_init(&osl->osl_seq_list_lock);
00628         sema_init(&osl->osl_seq_init_sem, 1);
00629 }
00630 
00631 static void osd_ost_seq_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd)
00632 {
00633         struct osd_seq_list     *osl = &osd->od_seq_list;
00634         struct osd_seq          *osd_seq, *tmp;
00635 
00636         write_lock(&osl->osl_seq_list_lock);
00637         list_for_each_entry_safe(osd_seq, tmp, &osl->osl_seq_list,
00638                                  os_seq_list) {
00639                 list_del(&osd_seq->os_seq_list);
00640                 OBD_FREE(osd_seq->os_compat_dirs,
00641                          sizeof(uint64_t) * osd_seq->os_subdir_count);
00642                 OBD_FREE(osd_seq, sizeof(*osd_seq));
00643         }
00644         write_unlock(&osl->osl_seq_list_lock);
00645 
00646         return;
00647 }
00648 
00652 static int
00653 osd_oi_init_compat(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o)
00654 {
00655         uint64_t         odb, sdb;
00656         int              rc;
00657         ENTRY;
00658 
00659         rc = osd_oi_find_or_create(env, o, o->od_root, "O", &sdb);
00660         if (rc)
00661                 RETURN(rc);
00662 
00663         o->od_O_id = sdb;
00664 
00665         osd_ost_seq_init(env, o);
00666         /* Create on-disk indexes to maintain per-UID/GID inode usage.
00667          * Those new indexes are created in the top-level ZAP outside the
00668          * namespace in order not to confuse ZPL which might interpret those
00669          * indexes as directories and assume the values are object IDs */
00670         rc = osd_oi_find_or_create(env, o, MASTER_NODE_OBJ,
00671                         oid2name(ACCT_USER_OID), &odb);
00672         if (rc)
00673                 RETURN(rc);
00674         o->od_iusr_oid = odb;
00675 
00676         rc = osd_oi_find_or_create(env, o, MASTER_NODE_OBJ,
00677                         oid2name(ACCT_GROUP_OID), &odb);
00678         if (rc)
00679                 RETURN(rc);
00680         o->od_igrp_oid = odb;
00681 
00682         RETURN(rc);
00683 }
00684 
00688 int osd_oi_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o)
00689 {
00690         char    *key = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_buf;
00691         int      i, rc, count = 0;
00692         ENTRY;
00693 
00694         rc = osd_oi_probe(env, o, &count);
00695         if (rc)
00696                 RETURN(rc);
00697 
00698         if (count == 0) {
00699                 uint64_t odb, sdb;
00700 
00701                 count = osd_oi_count;
00702                 odb = o->od_root;
00703 
00704                 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00705                         sprintf(key, "%s.%d", DMU_OSD_OI_NAME_BASE, i);
00706                         rc = osd_oi_find_or_create(env, o, odb, key, &sdb);
00707                         if (rc)
00708                                 RETURN(rc);
00709                 }
00710         }
00711 
00712         rc = osd_oi_init_compat(env, o);
00713         if (rc)
00714                 RETURN(rc);
00715 
00716         LASSERT((count & (count - 1)) == 0);
00717         o->od_oi_count = count;
00718         OBD_ALLOC(o->od_oi_table, sizeof(struct osd_oi *) * count);
00719         if (o->od_oi_table == NULL)
00720                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00721 
00722         rc = osd_oi_open_table(env, o, count);
00723         if (rc) {
00724                 OBD_FREE(o->od_oi_table, sizeof(struct osd_oi *) * count);
00725                 o->od_oi_table = NULL;
00726         }
00727 
00728         RETURN(rc);
00729 }
00730 
00731 void osd_oi_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o)
00732 {
00733         ENTRY;
00734 
00735         osd_ost_seq_fini(env, o);
00736 
00737         if (o->od_oi_table != NULL) {
00738                 (void) osd_oi_close_table(env, o);
00739                 OBD_FREE(o->od_oi_table,
00740                          sizeof(struct osd_oi *) * o->od_oi_count);
00741                 o->od_oi_table = NULL;
00742                 o->od_oi_count = 0;
00743         }
00744 
00745         EXIT;
00746 }
00747 
00748 int osd_options_init(void)
00749 {
00750         /* osd_oi_count - Default number of OIs, 128 works well for ZFS */
00751         if (osd_oi_count == 0 || osd_oi_count > OSD_OI_FID_NR_MAX)
00752                 osd_oi_count = OSD_OI_FID_NR;
00753 
00754         if ((osd_oi_count & (osd_oi_count - 1)) != 0) {
00755                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Round up osd_oi_count %d to power2 %d\n",
00756                         osd_oi_count, size_roundup_power2(osd_oi_count));
00757                 osd_oi_count = size_roundup_power2(osd_oi_count);
00758         }
00759 
00760         return 0;
00761 }
